settings.label: Settings
settings.comment: Documentation: Extension Documentation Google Shopping Specifications Google Apparel Examples

locale.label: Feed Localization
locale.comment:
Changing the language of your feed affects how Apparels are matched using Google taxonomies. Your products should also be in the same language.
Refer to 'Google Category of the Item' attribute.
Note, this setting does not affect price formatting, assure proper store language for that.

alternate_feed_dir.label: Feed path
alternate_feed_dir.comment:
• Dir path to save the feed.
• If empty the feed is saved in media/feeds/google_base_[Store Code].txt
• Relative paths are calculated relative to Magento base dir.
• Please make sure the path set here has enough permission for both web server user and cron user.

test_btn.comment:
• It will generate a test feed. It's saved in the same location.
• Enter sku to test a single product.
• Use an offset and a limit to generate a test feed for a limited number of products.

product_types.label: Submit only products of these types
product_types.comment: Products submitted to the feed have to be visible in Catalog, meaning visibility "Catalog", "Search", "Catalog, Search", but also "Not Visible Individually if they are part of a visible configurable".

qty_mode.label: Quantity mode
qty_mode.comment: 'This setting is used when mapping the quantity value to parent products types such as configurable or grouped.

use_batch_segmentation.label: Use Batch Segmentation
use_batch_segmentation.comment:
Recommended for catalogs with tens of thousands of products.
The generator will use a limited number of products to process. Will be executed multiple times until all products are processed.

batch_limit.label: Batch Limit
batch_limit.comment:
Max number of products to be processed in a single cron job.
It depends on the number of products in catalog and the desired ussage of memory.

find_and_replace.label: Find And Replace
find_and_replace.comment: Find and replace rules do apply at column output. The more rules you apply the slower your feed will be, not recommended for large catalogs. If you changed the column map, save the config first.

configurable_products.label: Configurable products - non apparels
configurable_products.comment:
Specific configurations for configurable products and associated products of configurables.
This section does not apply to apparel products.

associated_products_mode.label: How to add associated products
associated_products_mode.comment: Associated products can be added in the feed as separate items even if they are not visible in catalog.

add_out_of_stock_configurable_assoc.label: Add Out of Stock Products - Configurable Associated
add_out_of_stock_configurable_assoc.comment: For associated products of configurable products.

associated_products_link_add_unique.label: Associated products - Form unique urls for not visible associated products
associated_products_link_add_unique.comment:
The new unique url will be formed from configurable product url and the configurable attributes values of the associated product.
e.g http://example.com/configuable.html?color=123&size=99

associated_products_image_link_configura.label: Associated products - Fetch main image from

grouped_products.label: Grouped products - non apparels
grouped_products.comment:
Specific configurations for grouped products and associated products of grouped products.
This section does not apply to apparel products.

grouped_associated_products_mode.label: How to add associated products
grouped_associated_products_mode.comment: Associated products can be added in the feed as separate items even if they are not visible in catalog.

add_out_of_stock_grouped_assoc.label: Add Out of Stock Products - Associated Products

grouped_price_display_mode.label: Price Type
grouped_price_display_mode.comment:
'Minimal price' is the lowest associated product price.
'Sum of associated products prices' is the default quantity of each associated product multiplied with the price of the associated product and than summed together.

grouped_associated_products_link_add_uni.label: Associated products - Form unique urls for not visible associated products
grouped_associated_products_link_add_uni.comment:
The new unique url will be formed from grouped product url and the ids of the associated product.
e.g http://example.com/grouped.html?prod_id=123

grouped_associated_products_image_link.label: Associated products - Fetch main image from

columns.label: Feed Columns
columns.comment: Your Google Shopping Products Feed depends on your store configuration, types of products, available data stored in your products and others. Please carefully read Google Shopping Specifications to configure this extension properly.

map_product_columns.comment:
• If 'Static Value' is filled than it will always be used instead of 'Product Attribute'. Otherwise the 'Default Value' of catalog product attributes could be used.
• Accepted values for 'availability': 'in stock', 'available for order', 'out of stock', 'preorder'
• e.g. for Google Category of the Item: 'Apparel & Accessories > Clothing > Dresses'
• e.g. for Google Shopping Product Type: 'Home & Garden > Kitchen & Dining > Appliances > Refrigerators' or 'Home & Garden'
• Accepted values for Condition: 'new', 'used', 'refurbished'
• Accepted values for gender: 'Male', 'Female', 'Unisex'
• Accepted values for age_group: 'Kids', 'Adult'
• For Adwords Grouping use 'adwords_grouping'in Google Shopping Feed Column
• For Adwords Labels use 'adwords_labels'in Google Shopping Feed Column, adwords_labels expects labels to be separated by a comma. Read here

ttl.label: Days from Today that Feed Will Expire
ttl.comment: Number of days. Used to set expiration date.

id_store_code.label: Add Store Code to Product Id
id_store_code.comment:
In multistore configuration ids must be unique across all feeds in your account. Set to 'Yes' will concatenate the product id and the store code. Read here
'Unique Identifier to Id' config option from store view config may be used also.

id_add_store_unique.label: Unique Identifier to Id
id_add_store_unique.comment:
Adds text to ids instead of store code. Usually not required.
Use for a single account with multiple feeds from stores that may have same store code.
e.g. 2 Magento installs with 2 stores that have as store code [default]. Google Shopping Feed Specifications requires unique ids across all feeds in same account.

max_title_length.label: Max Length of Title
max_title_length.comment: Maximum length of title. Longer texts will be chunked. Recommended max length is 70. Set to empty, the title will not be chunked.

max_description_length.label: Max Length of Description
max_description_length.comment: Maximum length of description. Longer texts will be chunked. Recommended max length is 500-1000, but no longer than 10000. Set to empty, the description will not be chunked.

add_to_product_url.label: Add to Product URL
add_to_product_url.comment: Product URL will be concatenated with the text above. Can be used to track URLs. e.g. ?utm_source=google_shopping

add_to_adwords_product_url.label: Add to Adwords Product URL
add_to_adwords_product_url.comment: Adwords Redirect directive will utilise this value to append it at the end of regular product url. Can be used to track URLs. e.g. ?utm_source=google_shopping

use_default_stock.label: Use default Stock Statuses
use_default_stock.comment: Fills 'availability' with 'in stock' or 'out of stock' depending on product's stock status. When set to 'No' a valid product attribute is required.

stock_attribute_code.label: Alternate Stock/Availability Attribute.
stock_attribute_code.comment: To fill 'availability'. The attribute's values can be: 'in stock', 'available for order', 'out of stock', 'preorder'. Other values will be replaced by 'out of stock'.

add_tax_to_price.label: Add Tax to Price
add_tax_to_price.comment: For US feeds column 'price' should not include tax.

format_prices_locale.label: Format Prices
format_prices_locale.comment: Format price to current store locale. e.g. for fr_FR 1,000,000.99 will be 1.000.000,99

google_product_category_by_category.label: Google Product Category by Category
google_product_category_by_category.comment:
Values with empty order are matched last.
Values set here precedes 'Static Value' from 'Feed's Columns Map'.

product_type_by_category.label: Product Type by Category
product_type_by_category.comment:
Values with empty order are matched last.
Values set here precedes 'Static Value' from 'Feed's Columns Map'.

adwords_grouping_by_category.label: Adwords Grouping by Category
adwords_grouping_by_category.comment:
Values with empty order are matched last.
Values set here precedes 'Static Value' from 'Feed's Columns Map'.

adwords_labels_by_category.label: Adwords Labels by Category
adwords_labels_by_category.comment:
Values with empty order are matched last.
Values set here precedes 'Static Value' from 'Feed's Columns Map'. Separate labels with a comma.

adwords_price_buckets.label: Adwords Price Buckets
adwords_price_buckets.comment: Create price ranges and apply labels to them. Values set here precedes 'Static Value' from 'Feed's Columns Map'. To be used with 'Adwords Price Buckets' directive in column map.

map_replace_empty_columns.label: Replace empty values
map_replace_empty_columns.comment:
Rules with empty order are processed last.
Columns must be in 'Feeds's Columns Map'. Static value overrules attribute replacement.

skip_column_empty.label: Skip Products with empty
skip_column_empty.comment:
Don't add products in the feed that have empty cells values for above columns.
Columns must be in 'Feeds's Columns Map'.

skip_category.label: Skip Products From Categories
skip_category.comment: Don't add products in the feed from selected categories.

shipping.label: Shipping (Beta)
shipping.comment:
By adding the shipping column to the feed the generation time will greatly increase.
It is recommended to test the feed generation for 10/100 products (Test Feed Now button) before generating the entire feed for all products.
If it is possible set your shipping prices only in your Google Merchant Account.

enabled.label: Enable Shipping Feature
enabled.comment: To enable shipping you must also add a column named 'shipping' in Feed's Columns Map and map the column to the directive called 'Shipping'.

methods.label: Methods
methods.comment:
Allowed shipping methods.
Realtime carriers aren't allowed to avoid getting banned or to spam carriers' servers. e.g. UPS, USPS, FedEx, DHL, Royal Mail, ..
Please add/configure any realtime carriers in your Google Merchant account.

country.label: Countries
country.comment:
Shipping allowed countries.
Select only a few countries the avoid a very long feed generation and to keep the feed size to a minimnum.

by_region.label: Vary by Regions
by_region.comment:
Shipping price will vary by targeted regions.
Set to 'Yes' if any shipping method depends by regions.

country_with_region.label: Countries with Regions
country_with_region.comment:
Select for wich countries the shipping vary by regions. Countries selected must be in configuration 'Countries' above.
Improves feed generation speed.

only_minimum.label: Only Minimum Price
only_minimum.comment: If there are more carriers/shipping methods than the shipping column will be filled with only the minimum price and the related carrier/shipping method.

only_free_shipping.label: Only Free Shipping
only_free_shipping.comment: Add only free shipping when is available.

add_tax_to_price.label: Add Tax to Shipping Price
add_tax_to_price.comment: For US feeds column 'price' should not include tax.

format_prices_locale.label: Format Shipping Prices
format_prices_locale.comment: Format shipping price to current store locale. e.g. for fr_FR 1,000,000.99 will be 1.000.000,99

cache_enabled.label: Cache Shipping
cache_enabled.comment: Cache shipping data for every product.

apparel.label: Apparels
apparel.comment:
Google Shopping Specifications - Apparels
Google Shopping Specifications - Apparels Examples

All apparel columns used must be added to 'Feed Columns' > 'Feed's Columns Map' too.
Apparel products are identified by Google Category of the Item: 'Apparel & Accessories' (including all subcategories).
Clothing products are identified by Google Category of the Item: 'Apparel & Accessories > Clothing' (including all subcategories).
Shoes products are identified by Google Category of the Item: 'Apparel & Accessories > Shoes' (including all subcategories).

is_turned_on.label: Enabled
is_turned_on.comment: Products with Google Category: 'Apparel & Accessories' (including all subcategories) will be skipped if this option is set to 'No'.

associated_products_mode.label: How to add associated products
associated_products_mode.comment: Apparels are added in the feed a separated associated items, but it can also be set to add the parent configurable item.

attribute_overwrites.label: Configurable attribute overwrites
attribute_overwrites.comment:
Select the attributes of configurable product to be used for all associated simple product in the feed as apparel variants.
Overwrite of configurable options attribute like 'size' will be ignored because overwriting it will ignore apparel detection.

variants_submit_no_img.label: Submit Apparel Variants Without Images
variants_submit_no_img.comment: Google Shopping Feed Specification states 'No'. When set to 'Yes', if there is no image available for an associated product than it will use configurable's product image.

allow_empty_color_size.label: Allow Apparel without Color or Size
allow_empty_color_size.comment: When set to NO, the functionality applies to all other apparels than configurable ones, where products with missing color or size are skipped. Configurable apparels are not been skipped but instead, they are been replaced with the valid associated product having minimal price.

associated_products_link_add_unique.label: Associated products - Form unique urls for not visible associated products
associated_products_link_add_unique.comment:
The new unique url will be formed from configurable product url and the configurable attributes values of the associated product.
e.g http://example.com/configuable.html?color=123&size=99

size_attribute_code.label: Size Attributes
size_attribute_code.comment: Size column has relevance only for Google Categories of the Item 'Apparel & Accessories > Clothing' and 'Apparel & Accessories > Shoes'.

age_group_attribute_code.label: Age Group Attributes
age_group_attribute_code.comment: To fill age_group. The attributes' values can be: 'Kids', 'Adult'. Other values will be replaced by empty string.

age_group_not_req_categories.label: Age Group - Not required for categories
age_group_not_req_categories.comment: Google category words that should make 'Age Group Attribute' not required when "Allow Apparel without Color or Size" is ON

gender_attribute_code.label: Gender Attributes
gender_attribute_code.comment: To fill gender. The attributes' values can be: 'Male', 'Female', 'Unisex'. Other values will be replaced by empty string.

gender_not_req_categories.label: Gender - Not required for categories
gender_not_req_categories.comment: Google category words that should make 'Gender Attribute' not required when "Allow Apparel without Color or Size" is ON

variant_additional_columns.label: Additional Variant Columns
variant_additional_columns.comment: Comma separated values. Ex: type,compression,toe. Additional columns that could vary, besides: color, size, pattern, material

attribute_merge_value_separator.label: Associated Product Attribute Value Separator
attribute_merge_value_separator.comment: Variant attributes values like color and size, defined above, are been merged together for each item using the separator defined here.
